title: Dublin’s Housing First programme is on pause, raising questions about competitive tendering for social care services
content: “Housing First works best when it is high quality, consistent and for as long as necessary,” says Samara Jones, coordinator of the Housing First Europe Hub.

title: After years of work by council, government abruptly spiked policy meant to deliver arts spaces in the city
content: “It was hugely dispiriting,” says Labour Councillor Darragh Moriarty, who chairs Dublin City Council’s arts committee.

title: Housing biggest winner from National Development Plan review with €35.9bn allocated
content: Housing is the biggest winner from the review of the National Development Plan (NDP), with the department to be given €35.9 billion to spend between 2026 and 2030.

title: National Development Plan: €275bn to be spent over next 10 years, with housing receiving biggest boost
content: Investment in housing, water and grid infrastructure, defence, prisons and sports facilities planned under NDP

title: Government to invest €102bn in infrastructure by 2030 under revised National Development Plan
content: The Government’s revised National Development Plan will see €102bn spent on infrastructure by 2030 — but project specifics remain pending

title: 'Profound disappointment' after Mayo social housing fire
content: Mayo County Council has expressed its "profound disappointment" following a fire at a site earmarked for social housing in Ballina overnight.

title: Govt to discuss checks on planning legal challenges
content: Businesses and individuals bringing legal challenges to planning decisions will face additional restrictions under changes being discussed at Cabinet today.

title: AIB hybrid working policy 'regressive and shortsighted'
content: The Financial Services Union (FSU) has described an announcement by AIB of changes to its hybrid working policy as regressive, shortsighted and without justification.

title: Council 'profoundly disappointed' after homes earmarked for social housing damaged by fire
content: The two houses were recently approved for refurbishment.

title: Houses, water, health and Metrolink: The key points from the National Development Plan
content: The plan sets out what large-scale infrastructure projects Ireland needs over the next five to ten years.

title: Simon Harris wants to see emergency planning designation for Ipas centres phased out
content: Planning permissions have been a feature of protests against some accommodation for people seeking international protection.
